Based on your preferences and the information provided, I would recommend the movie "A Tale of Two Cities" (1859) by Charles Dickens.
The plot of "A Tale of Two Cities" follows two very different people: Charles Darnay, a wealthy French aristocrat who is involved in a political scandal; and Sydney Carton, an alcoholic lawyer from London who is hired to rescue Darnay from the political scandal.
Throughout the story, Darnay becomes increasingly involved in the political scandal, which leads to his imprisonment. During this time, Carton continues to work tirelessly on Darnay's behalf, even though he knows that Darnay will never forgive him for betraying him and leaving him behind when he was still a little boy.
In the end, Carton is able to rescue Darnay from the political scandal, and they are able to start a new life together.
